home.headline: Data Scientist specializing in MLOps
about: I am a Data Scientist with a strong MLOps and cloud foundation, focused on building production-ready machine learning systems rather than standalone models.

My work spans the full ML lifecycle: data ingestion, feature engineering, model development, deployment, monitoring, and iteration. I recently led the development of an industrial predictive-maintenance system, combining interpretable ML models with a real-time monitoring dashboard to support operational decision-making in manufacturing environments.

I am particularly interested in the reliability and scalability of ML systems. My recent training and hands-on work emphasize Docker, Kubernetes, Linux, GitHub Actions, Terraform (Infrastructure as Code), and AWS, enabling reproducible pipelines, automated deployments, and maintainable cloud infrastructure.

With a background that bridges mechanical engineering and data science, I bring a systems-level mindset to ML problems—grounding models in physical intuition, operational constraints, and real-world impact. I aim to build ML products that are not only accurate, but deployable, observable, and trusted by end users.

highlights: Graduate training in applied machine learning, MLOps, and data-driven decision making.
Strong emphasis on end-to-end ML systems, reproducibility, and production readiness.
Artificial Intelligence Option and Management Science Option.
Strong foundation in systems engineering, controls, and applied mathematics.

projects.title: Production-Grade MLOps System for Stock Price Forecasting
projects.tagline: Registry-driven ML deployment with AutoML and transformer-based models on AWS.
bullets: Built a production-ready MLOps system enabling reliable training, promotion, and serving of time-series forecasting models across local and AWS environments.
Integrated multiple model families—including classical baselines, AutoML (FLAML), and transformer-based models from Hugging Face—under a single MLflow registry and serving interface.
Implemented registry-backed model promotion with explicit aliasing (‘@prod’) to decouple experimentation from production inference.
Deployed a containerized FastAPI inference service on AWS ECS behind an Application Load Balancer, validated through live end-to-end prediction requests.
projects.summary: Designed and deployed a production-grade MLOps system for time-series forecasting that supports multiple modeling approaches, including AutoML and transformer-based models from Hugging Face. The project emphasizes operational correctness through registry-driven model promotion, reproducible training, and live cloud inference on AWS, demonstrating end-to-end ownership from experimentation to production serving.

projects.title: Time Series Forecasting for TSLA Stock Prices
projects.tagline: Applied deep learning for attention-based financial time-series forecasting.
bullets: Built an attention-based time-series forecasting model to learn temporal patterns in real-world equity price data.
Demonstrated the practical use of sequence models for noisy, non-stationary financial time series.
Evaluated forecasting quality using multiple regression metrics to assess stability and generalization.
projects.summary: Applied an attention-based deep learning model to forecast Tesla (TSLA) stock prices, focusing on learning temporal dependencies in noisy financial time series. The project emphasizes practical modeling considerations, evaluation rigor, and the strengths and limitations of deep sequence models in real-world forecasting tasks.

projects.summary: End-to-end predictive maintenance system built on real-world industrial sensor data, combining interpretable machine learning, time-series feature engineering, and deployment-ready workflows. projects.title: AI Wall Painting Robot – Wall Segmentation
projects.tagline: Deep learning-based wall surface segmentation for robotic painting automation.
bullets: Implemented a Pyramid Scene Parsing Network (PSPNet) for industrial wall segmentation.
Designed an encoder–decoder architecture with a PPM-based decoder for pixel-wise classification.
Evaluated multiple training strategies including transfer learning and end-to-end training.
Achieved 92.13% accuracy and 72.58% IoU, enabling reliable automated wall-surface detection.
Preprocessed data by flattening irregular wall segments, resizing images, and applying data augmentation.
projects.summary: Deep learning–based wall surface segmentation system for robotic painting automation, using a PSPNet encoder–decoder architecture with pyramid pooling. The model achieves high accuracy and IoU through careful data preprocessing, augmentation, and training strategy evaluation, enabling reliable pixel-level wall detection in industrial environments.

projects.summary: Lightweight MLOps monitoring and cloud cost guard designed for small ML teams, focused on production-critical signals such as data drift, prediction distributions, inference latency, and cost attribution.
